title: Romania withdraws interim commissioner nomination
text:
Romania has dropped its nomination of Ioan Mircea Pașcu for a fill-in commissioner in the outgoing Juncker Commission | Patrick Seeger/EPA-EFE Romania withdraws interim commissioner nomination Ioan Mircea Pașcu was the last man standing for a fill-in job in the Juncker Commission.

Romania has dropped its nomination of Ioan Mircea Pașcu for a fill-in commissioner in the outgoing Juncker Commission, the government told EU institutions in a letter seen by POLITICO.

"The Prime Minister of Romania, Mrs Viorica Dăncilă, decided to withdraw Romania's proposal regarding the interim Commissioner for the period remaining until October 31," the country's EU ambassador Luminiţa Odobescu wrote in the letter, dated Wednesday (September 11).

Pașcu said Wednesday morning he is aware of the move: "I have been informed by the [Romanian] ambassador to the EU, Luminița Odobescu, that she was instructed to withdraw my candidacy for Romanian interim commissioner," Pașcu wrote on Facebook.

He said he has taken note of the decision by Dăncilă, and would comply with it.

Bucharest had nominated Pașcu to replace Corina Crețu, who quit her job as Romania's European commissioner to take up a seat as an MEP in July, for the remainder of the Juncker Commission, which finishes its term at the end of October. Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker had called on countries not to nominate fill-in commissioners, saying their entitlements would be a waste of taxpayers' money, and pledged not to give any fill-ins a portfolio.

The EPP group in the Parliament had called for Pașcu's nomination process to be stopped, but Paşcu told POLITICO's Brussels Playbook: “My government submitted my candidature, it is for my government to withdraw it.”

Paşcu said his pension wouldn’t exactly break the EU bank: “The basic amount for a mandate of more than one month but less than two months is €68 per month, possibly minus a sickness insurance contribution of €49 a month.”

Pașcu was the last man standing for a fill-in job in the Juncker Commission, after Estonia withdrew its nomination of Kadri Simson to replace departed Commissioner Andrus Ansip, who also quit to take up an MEP seat. Simson is Estonia's commissioner-designate for Commission President-elect Ursula von der Leyen's College of Commissioners.
description: Ioan Mircea Pașcu was the last man standing for a fill-in job in the Juncker Commission.
